The 97-page text of CIE 171:2006, "Test Cases to Assess the Accuracy of
Lighting Computer Programs" is of course copyrighted by the Commission
Internationale de l'Eclairage (CIE). It can be ordered for 36 EU members /
108 EU non-members from http://www.techstreet.com/cie?. (At today's currency
exchange rates, 48 and 143 USD respectively.)


Having said this, most of the text is devoted to the mathematical
development of the analytic tests and background information on the physical
models. The tests themselves are reasonably well described in:


http://www.dau.ca/ddci/files/Download/ReportonAGI32validationofCIE171_Compil
ed_070620.pdf


which is freely available.


It would be best if both the test models (which are not subject to copyright
limitations) and the test results are made publicly available.


Ian Ashdown, P. Eng., FIES
President
byHeart Consultants Limited
http://www.helios32.com
